chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
The defendant Alison Rhea Hendrickson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Alison Rhea Hendrickson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Alison Rhea Hendrickson was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- 3 days jail credit in the event of revocation
- Report to probation no later than today, 6/14/22 by 12:00 pm. 
- Supervision may be transferred to Minnesota

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

08:33 AM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA:  Holly Elkin Rockow, DF ATTY:  A.W. Schutte, DF: Alison Rhea Hendrickson appeared. ADA Rockow recites agreement, amends Ct 1 to Obstructing an Officer. DE sworn. DE pleads GUILTY to amended Ct 1 - Obstructing an Officer. Court reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Court finds DE knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waives rights and makes plea. Court accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of amended Ct 1 - Obstructing an Officer. On motion of the State without objection, Court dismisses Ct 2. Sentencing recommendations. Defendant advised of appeal rights. Adjourned: 

Court orders:
Ct 1 - Obstructing an Officer
S/W 1 year probation with conditions:
- Maintain absolute sobriety
- Random testing at direction of Agent
- AODA or Rule 25 and follow any recommended treatment
- No abusive contact with Shawn G.
- Submit letter of apology to Shawn G. and Officer Max Berger 
- Court Costs $243; payable through Clerk of Court
- DNA Sample and Surcharge $200; payable through Clerk of Court

3 days jail credit in the event of revocation.
Court authorizes supervision to be transferred to Minnesota.
Apply bond on file, payment plan approved to continue. 
Defendant to report to probation no later than today, 6/14/22 by 12:00 PM.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Filed by DA's Office. km
Status conference on April 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Shawn G.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
